Sequence Information.Peptide Name: LS-AMP-F1 (Lys-rich; natural AMPs; Spiders, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals, UCLL1)

Literature.Author: Tan H, Wang J, Song Y, Liu S, Lu Z, Luo H, Tang X.2022
Literature.Title: Antibacterial Potential Analysis of Novel alpha-Helix Peptides in the Chinese Wolf Spider Lycosa sinensis.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (52.63%) toLC-AMP-F1K: 26%, G: 16%, L: 21%. GRAVY: 0.216; Mol Wt: 2048.591; mol formula: C95H170N24O23S1; mol ex coeff: 1490.Activity:  active against Gram- S. typhimurium CGMCC1.1174 (MIC 12.5 uM), E. coli  CCTCC AB 2012883 and 10 clinical strains (MIC 12.5-50 uM), P. aeruginosa 4 clinical strains (MIC 25->50), A. baumannii 6 clinical strains (MIC 3.1-25 uM), S. dysenteriae CGMCC 1.1869 (MIC 25 uM), P-vulgaris CGMCC 1.1651 (MIC >50 uM), Gram+ E. faecium 2 clinical strains (MIC 12.5 uM), S. albus CGMCC 1.3374 (MIC 6.25 uM), S. aureus  4 clincial strains (MIC 25-100 uM), and S. citreus CCTCC AB 91115 (MIC 6.25 uM). Inhibit the formation of biofilms:bacteria:E. coli.Synergy:antibiotics:   Synergy with Azithromycin, Erythromycin, and Doxycycline against E. coli or S. albus.
